title: Fatty and the Bandit Winter Race #2
Fatty and the Bandit Winter Race #3
The Velo Shop / LWA Racing Spring Training Series
Gravel Grape Crusher
description:
This ain't no April Fools joke!
Ride through the grapes on April 1st. Join Velo Amis for the inaugural Gravel Grape Crusher - a challenging 25 or 50 mile ride, beginning and ending at Paradocx Vineyard.
course: Both routes are a mix of gravel, double track, single track, field and road, with features in Fair Hill, White Clay, Redd Park and White Clay Preserve. Two rest stops for the 50 mile - one for the 25 mile.
registration: Register online: https://www.bikereg.com/ggc
notes: Bring your friends and family for post ride fun.
directions: 1833 Flint Hill Rd, Landenberg, PA  19350

title: Monkey Knife Fight presented by Funk Brewing & South Mountain Cycle
description: Monkey Knife Fight
course: 64 miles of the most beautiful, dirty, and hilly roads south of Emmaus, PA
registration: https://www.bikereg.com/monkey-knife-fight
notes: It's a fun ride, not a race.
directions: Camp Olympic, Emmaus, PA

title: Brandywine Valley Roubaix II
description:
Chester County Velo and WCCX are pleased to announce the 2nd Annual Brandywine Valley Roubaix (BVR).  This Gravel Grinder / Gran Fondo will take riders through the scenic country-side and rolling hills of the Brandywine Valley, some of the most unspoiled and historic countryside of the Mid-Atlantic.  

Amenities include:

Starbucks coffee at registration / check in 
A fantastic rest stop at mile 35 (powered the The Whip Tavern)
Apple cider donuts at the top Hickory Hill Rd at mile 53 
Pizza and craft "adult beverage" at the finish
course: The full ride is 58 miles (and 4,000 feet of climbing) with over 40% consisting of gravel / mixed surface roads including the famed 1 mile long Hill Top Road climb (10% grade in some sections) and several newly added gravel sections.  The course is suited for both road bikes (25 mm tires best) and cyclocross bikes, and will have a road bypass option for avoiding several of the more technical sections.
registration:
Register here:  https://www.bikereg.com/brandywine-valley-roubaix2

Event pricing:

Until March 1 - $25.00
March 2 - April 8 - $30.00
"Day of" registration - $35.00
notes:
As with all previous WCCX events a portion of the proceeds will benefit two local charities.  Quest Therapeutics (www.questtherapeutic.com) is an equestrian facility utilizing horse riding to provide therapy for children and adults with physical and developmental challenges.  Our second charity is the Pennsylvania Interscholastic Mountain Bike Association (www.pamtb.org),  a new, grass-roots organization developing high and middle school mountain bike programs in our immediate area.

The BVR will be supported by Bike Line (www.bikeline.com) although riders are responsible for on-the-course mechanicals.  A feed stop and facilities will be located at approximately mile marker 35, near the historic Whip Tavern (thewhiptavern.com).  This event is a timed Gran Fondo and all riders must obey the rules of the road. 

We will provide several routing options for the ride with marketings / signage along the course, including:

Full ride with all gravel sections and climbs (58 miles)
Full ride with road bypass (60 miles)
25 mile ride (combination of road and gravel)
directions: GPS Address:  100 Colonial Way, West Chester, PA 19382

title: Allegheny Cycling Assocation Tuesday Night Criterium
Allegheny Cycling Assocation Wednesday Night Criterium
Erie Spring Criterium
description: A day of criterium (lap) racing for men, women and juniors, with a 30-minute structured practice ride on the course held at 10am for all pre-registered racers.  This is a 3-week series, with awards for individual categories each week and a series award.
course:
The West Fairview course is 1.1km per lap with four turns and is closed to traffic. There are four small climbs on the course for a total of 60 feet of climbing per lap.
Visit https://www.strava.com/routes/864069 for a course map.
registration: Pre-registration is available online only through USAcycling.org. There will be no option for race day registration; all racers must register online by 10pm Saturday before each race day.  For assistance with resolving registration problems, contact membership@usacycling.org on a weekday.
notes: On race day, racers will receive a bib number and matching ChipCard for their seat post. For racers doing more than one race, the same bib and ChipCard will be used.  New bibs will be issued each week. ChipCards must be returned to the registration table when finished racing for the day.
directions: The West Fairview course is located in Fairview, PA close to exit 16 on Interstate 90.  The parking lot is adjacent to the course at 7601 Klier Dr N, Fairview, PA 16415

title: Daniel Harwi Memorial 30th Annual Lower Providence Spring Classic Crit
description: Daniel Harwi Memorial 30th Annual Lower Providence Spring Classic Criterium
course: Crit
registration:
NEW RACE ORDER!  Many riders asked if we would consider adjusting the race order to accomodate riders wishing to double or triple up for the day. We hope this new order makes this possible.  Make a day of it and get some solid racing miles in!

 

STATE CHAMPIONSHIPS SPECIAL NOTE:   This year's event has been designated as the 2016 Pennsylvania Cycling Association Junior State Championships for men and women who are 9-10, 11-12, and 13-14.   Non-Pennsylvania riders are invited to all races.

 

Women's 1/2/3 riders:   We are working hard to increase the payout for your field.   Please spread the word to others to please come and support our efforts towards moving in this direction.  

 

Race proceeds benefit:  Crushing Cancer for Chrissy Arrow Karabin for our teammate Tim Karabin and the Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Association for Daniel Harwi who we have never forgotten in these 29 years.

 

Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy Association

 

PARKING UPDATE - ALL RACE Parking is in the same new location as last year on the outside of the course this year. No parking in the center lots you may have grown accustomed to as we've worked with the township to make this race safer and an institution for Lower Providence as they've given us a permanent parking opportunity. Let's not make the businesses in this part resent us by parking in their lots.

Race parking is in a parking lot on the corner of Van Buren Ave and Adams Ave (at turn #4). There are two lots to choose from. The best way is to turn from Audubon Road onto Adams Ave. This will bring into the office park. Proceed to what is turn #4 of the race course. On your left is race parking. 

Also if you are coming in off of Rittenhouse Road, you could turn onto Van Buren Ave and parking will be on your right at the second driveway. Registration will be near start finish and in this lot to keep things compact/easy.  As well, registration will be in this lot to keep things compact/easy.

Please listen to the marshalls when they direct you to the parking location.

As always, this is a PCA / BAR race (www.pacycling.org)

Many thanks to our five sponsors of the event:

 

1.) The Performance Lab powered by the Rothman Institute (www.theperformancelabnj.com)

2.) Caffeinated Cyclist (www.tccyclist.com)

3.) Pennsylvania's Women's Racing Series (www.pawomensracing.blogspot.com)

4.) Lower Providence Township (www.lowerprovidence.org)

5.) Talksoft Corporation (www.talksoftonline.com).

 

Without supporters of this support we'd not have great events to gather and compete at. Please make your support of these sponsors known by going to their websites or storefronts and letting them know you recognize them as a stand-up company who supports what you like to do.  That in itself will provide them with the ROI to continuing to help support cycling events in the Mid-Atlantic.

Couple things to note:

1) This is one of the top three highest attended criteriums in Pennsylvania - (last year had 400+ racers!!!).
2) This is the longest running criterium in the state.
3) All races are designed to be USA Cycling upgrade worthy (As all races SHOULD be)!


Women's events - We have worked hard to ensure that women racers have as many opportunities to race as possible.   We feel that it is important there be a Women's Cat 4 race in addition to the 1/2/3 and W35+ races.   Please be sure to put us on your calendar.

PA Women's Series: a season-long points competition open to all women racers of all ages. Racers do not have to live in PA to participate in the Series.   The Women's PA BAR series is open to PA resident riders only.  For more information, go to pawomensracing.blogspot.com.     
 

Fine Print/Details: 

$5 Late Fee in effect as of 4/16 10:00 AM EST (please register by Friday night).
2015 BAR Champions race for free. Email prior to registration and you will be added to the registration. BAR Champions are required to wear their BAR jerseys.
Each additional race is $15 if pre registered, $20 day of the race.
Payout is 1/2 amount listed if <25 racers in event (exceptions-women, juniors).
Race is run rain or shine.
Promoter reserves the right to shorten, combine or alter events as needed due to weather, timing and other uncontrollable circumstances (crash delays, injuries, needs of Police, EMTs, Acts of God).
Course: 1 Mile, Clockwise, Mostly Flat, 4-corner crit with Free Laps/wheel pit.
Maximum field limit is 125 for all races except all Junior races and the Cat 5/Citizens where the limit is 50. 
Registration opens at 7:15 am.
No aero bars.  Approved helmets must be worn..
All USA Cycling rules apply. 
Entry fee includes insurance surcharge of $3.75 for USA Cycling & $10 for Citizens. 
Promoter reserves the right to combine or cancel races if less than 12 racers register for an event.
Masters races for Cats 1-4 only.
Directions:  Go to www.mapquest.com and type in directions from your location to the corner of Van Buren Ave & Adams Ave., Norristown, PA 19403

 

For Information: Ken Walsh - woodsretreat@hotmail.com.

title: Northeast Regional Junior Track Omnium championship & out-of-competiti
2017 Maxxis Gravity Series #2 ( Duryea Downhill )
description: 2017 Maxxis Gravity Series #2 (Duryea Downhill)
course: Start atop Mt. Penn.  Finish near City Park Bandshell
registration: Online at USACycling.org. $15 more onsite
notes:
Saturday, May 6th
– Practice: 10am- 4pm

Sunday, May 7th Raceday!
– Practice: 9am – 11am
– Race start: 12 noon
– Race finish: No set time, but historically around 3pm
directions: City Park/Mt Penn. Reading Pa.

title: Smoketown Airport Criterium
description: Since 2009, The Smoketown Airport Criterium has been one of the mainstay events of Pennsylvania racing. The past 6 years the bike race has had over 200 participants. This event is held on the runways and the connecting taxi roads located on the airport’s property,.  With the openness of the course, spectators are able to see all of the races as it unfolds. This feature creates a very unique viewing experience  unlike any other race in the area.
course: The Smoketown Airport Crit course offers the unique experience of racing on an airport runway. The course offers spectators a full view of the race from just about everywhere along the course and is very safe (no curbs and surrounded by grass). The course is a 1 mile loop with 3 gradual turns and one 180 degree high speed corner.
registration:
Pre Registration : $30 (Additional races are $10)
Day of registration: $40  (Additional races are $20)
Phttps://www.bikereg.com/smoketown-criterium
notes:
-PA BAR RACE
-All prizes are cash unless noted otherwise.Purse subject to change.
-RACE WILL BE HELD RAIN OR SHINE
-All master catergories are for liscenced racers in catergories 1-4 only.
-Contact: Ben Strine 484 502-7195 or email Benstrine@gmail.com
-HELD UNDER USA CYCLING PERMIT 
-Sponsored by THRU-IT-ALL CYCLING TEAM. Only the above listed races are permitted and sanctioned by USA cycling. No other races or activities at the event are sanctioned by USA cycling.
directions: DIRECTIONS: Use 311 Airport Drive, Bird In Hand, Pa 17505

title: Farm to Fork Fondo - Pennsylvania Dutch
description: Enjoy a simplicity that can only be found in Amish country where farming and gathering is an elemental tradition experienced perfectly from the seat of a bicycle.
course: GRAN - 85MI; MEDIO - 55MI; PICCOLO - 28MI; RAMBLE RIDE - 9MI
registration: https://endurancecui.active.com/event-reg/select-race?e=41914151&_ga=1.7169393.2146598795.1487610147
directions: The Country Barn - 211 S Donnerville Rd, Lancaster, PA

title: 2017 MAC Dual Slalom #2 (Blue Mtn)
description: 2017 Mid-Atlantic Cup DUAL SLALOM #2 at Blue Mountain
course: Man Made Dual Slalom course (Gate start,  Berms, rollers, tables etc..)
registration: Register Online at USACycling.org  Save Time & Money
notes:
All registered racers will qualify.
All racers guaranteed at least one timed seeding run and 2 head to head heats (left lane & right lane) 
Seeding run determines who you race head to head based on finishing order.  Winners advance based on heat times and a maximum 1.5 second advantage.  2nd heat win breaks times that are tied.
directions:
Blue Mountain Ski Area
1660 Blue Mountain Dr.
Palmerton, Pa. 18071.

title: Fifth Street Cyclocross Training Series Presented by South Mountain Cy
Reading Radsport Festival  Twilight Criterium & Mt. Penn Hill Climb
Reading Radsport Festival Mt. Penn Citizen's Ride
Bikeout
description: Bikeout is a bike camping journey connecting residents of Philadelphia to the abundant natural and civic resources in the surrounding communities.
course: Participants will meet at the Philadelphia Museum of Art and bike about 38 miles to Camphill Village Kimberton Hills using the Schuylkill River Trail. Once at the campsite, participants will be provided with a farm-to-table dinner prepared by a local chef using ingredients entirely sourced from the farm.

title: Thompson Criterium of Doylestown
description: Beautiful criterium around an arts festival in a Victorian town. Huge crowds, live web stream, 15th year of the event. PRT and USA Crits for pro men and women, Cat 2/3 men, high wheel and children's races
course: 1.4-mile/2/2-kilometer racecourse centered in Doylestown, Pennsylvania. PRT Men - 100K/62M -  1080m/3555' elevation. PRT Women and Cat 2/3 Men - 40K/25M - 384m/1264' elevation
registration:
Pro Men by team invitation only 
Pro Women & Cat 2/3 Men - www.bikereg.com/thompsoncriterium
notes: Do not park on street, use parking garage
directions: PA Route 611 bypass around Doylestown to Broad St Exit. Follow directly to Bucks County Parking Garage (free). Race is 200m from the garage

title: The Great 100
description:
Return of The Great 100 is a Charity Ride with three mileage options of 38, 62, and 100 miles. The ride is fully supported, including designated Rest Stops.

Ride the challenging 38 Mile Option (1/2 Metric Century), the 62 Mile Option (Metric Century), or the full 100 Mile Option (Full Century).

Start / Finish @ Luzerne County Community College
1333 South Prospect Street Nanticoke, PA 18634
course: Good pavement.  Mostly country roads.
registration: https://www.bikereg.com/the-great-100-3-ride-options

title: Honor Ride Philadelphia
description: Non-competitive bicycle ride to benefit injured veterans and first responders
course: http://projecthero.org/events/honor-ride?p=2
registration: http://projecthero.org/events/honor-ride?p=2
notes: n/a
directions: Doylestown Central Park

title: West Chester Cross Classic VI
description:
Don't miss the 6th year for this excellent event.  Consistantly rated one of the top cross overall races in the PACX series, conveniently located just outside of West Chester on Route 202.  Classic cyclocross course with two sets of barriers and variable terrain mostly grass, with some gravel. The 2.2 mile closed course is great for spectators. Course will be flowing and challenging, making use of natural run-ups, off cambers sections, and lots of cornering. While the venue is new...the course is still designed by “angry” Bob Reuther, local cross legend and long time advocate of local cycling...so you know it will be AWESOME!

Special Notes:  As in the past years, this race serves as a fund raiser for the Rustin Wrestling team.
course: Classic cyclocross course with two sets of barriers and variable terrain mostly grass, with some gravel. The 2.2 mile closed course is great for spectators. Course will be flowing and challenging, making use of natural run-ups, off cambers sections, and lots of cornering.
registration:
Pre-registration will be open on bikereg.com until October 13, 2017 11:00PM.

·         There is a $10 late fee for day-of registration.

·         Day of Registration and sign-in will be open at 8AM and will close 30 min prior to each race.

·         A USAC license is required to participate in this race, day-of and annual licenses will be available for purchase at registration.

·         Additional races - only $10!

·         Registration price includes $3 USAC insurance fee.
notes:
Call-up Protocol: 

·         Call-ups will only be awarded by promoter discretion. We will try to utilize current PACX series standings or 2016 final standings.

·         Staging will begin 10 minutes prior to each race

 Lapped Riders:

Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as the leaders. Riders in danger of being lapped must yield to oncoming racers and are not to interfere with their progress or trail behind them.

 Technical Pit:

A double sided pit will be marked and available approximately halfway through the course. If riders enter the pit, they must make some sort of exchange or mechanical adjustment.

Results:

Results will be posted at the registration area. Results will be made final 15 minutes after being posted. Podium, awards, and photos will occur roughly a half hour after each race.

Note:

·         The course will be open for inspection and warm-up at approximately 8:00am.

·         Every racer must have an approved helmet.

·         Mountain bikes will be allowed WITHOUT bar ends.

·         No aero bars. 

·         Check out our Website for updates and photos!

Disclaimer:

The Promoter reserves the right to combine categories, change times, etc.
directions:
GPS Address:
1060 Wilmington Pike, West Chester, PA  19382

address.street: Stoudts Brewing Co, 2800 N Reading Road

title: Franklin Park Grandprix (WPCX#3)
description:
The Franklin Park Gand Prix presented by Clearview FCU will be the third race in the WPCX cross series.  This race (hosted by the Nugo Racing Team) will be held in South Franklin Township Community in Washington PA (~40 miles from Pittsburgh), the site of previous ABRA cyclocross races. As in past years, the race will feature a sand pit, plenty of hills, barriers, grass and a steep hill (gunnar’s hill) in the back of the course.

* A special most aggressive rider award will be given to the rider in each category cresting Gunnar’s hill first on the first lap.

Enter a second race for just $10.

Day of registration available up to 30 minutes before race time. Single day licenses also available.

This all New WPCX cross series is an eleventh hour idea between a group of us to come together and give Western Pa its own little series. The races should first and foremost be about having fun.

Series points will be totaled and additional races will be posted on a facebook page which is coming soon!

The first race will be SRU Cyclocross at “The Rock” on 9-17-17.

The second race will be the CXAppeal presented by La Prima Racing https://m.facebook.com/CXappeal/ on 10-14-17.

The third race will be this one, the Franklin Park Grandprix presented by Clearview FCU!

All prizes and payouts are dependant on the number of racers. If racer turnout is lower than prize money being offered then we reserve the right to lower payouts. Merchadise prizes will be provided by Morr Protective Gear (https://www.morrgear.com/) and NuGo Nutrition.

Bikes Allowed - Cyclocross, Mountain, and Hybrid
course: The race will feature a sand pit, plenty of hills, barriers, grass and a steep hill (gunnar’s hill) in the back of the course.
registration: Day of registration available up to 30 minutes before race time. Single day licenses also available.
notes: Enter a second race for just $10.
directions:
199 Municipal Rd
Washington, PA
15301

title: Sly Fox Cross presented by Bikesport
description:
In the time honored Belgian tradition of cyclocross and beer, Sly Fox Brewing Company presents the

4th Annual Sly Fox Cross! With a course that wraps around an outdoor Sly Fox beer garden, spectators can heckle racers at the top of the run up out of the Fox Hole, then run across the beer garden to catch them going across the Sly Fox barriers. Sly Fox will be providing their regular food menu so you can make a day out of it. What better way to combine the Sly Fox community with the cycling community than with a race? Please see BikeReg for beer and food deals.
course: A 1.5 mile hard, technical course with a large run up.
registration: Registration through Bikereg.REGISTRATION: Day of registration opens at 8:00AM and closes 15 minutes prior to each events posted start time. The Day-of Registration Service Charge is $10.00 (so preregister and save)!  Unlicensed riders must purchase a One-Day license ($15.00) to race. The standard USAC 2017 Event Release Form is used. No mail-in registration. No Refunds.
notes:
LICENSING:  A current USAC domestic license is required for USAC events. One-day licenses may ONLY be used in the Cat 5 Men’s event and the Cat 4 Women’s events.  One-day licenses may NOT be used for Master Men events.

USAC Annual and One-Day licenses will be available for sale.

FACILITIES: The Sly Fox Tastin' Room will be open for food and beverages. There will be an outside Beer-Garden on the course with food as well. OUTSIDE FOOD AND BEER IS NOT PERMITTED!  

WARMUPS: The course will be open at 8:15AM for pre-riding/inspection on the morning of race ONLY. Warmups may begin approximately 10 minutes prior to each race.  Racers that dont follow these rules will be DQ and forfeit their entry fee.

CALL-UP PROTOCALL:  Pre-registered riders will be called up in order of when the registered, followed by day-of riders...  Riders may begin staging in the start area 10 minutes prior to the start of each event.

LAPPED RIDERS: Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as the leaders. Riders in danger of being lapped must yield to oncoming racers and are not to interfere with their progress or trail behind them. Lapped riders may be pulled at the discretion of USA Cycling officials.
directions:
331 Circle of Progress Drive
Pottstown, PA 19464

address.street: Victory Brewing Company 3127 Lower Valley Rd

title: Carrie Furnace Blast
description: Carrie Furnace Blast Cyclocross Race.  A Cyclocross race on the property of the last standing steel mills of the early 20th century.
course: Mostly flat, but technical Cyclocross course winding between massive buildings, blast furnaces, and industrial parkland.
registration:
Registration on Bikereg.com. Online registration ends November 10th at 10pm.

One day licenses available for Beginner fields, Cat 4/5 and Junior rider so for $10. All others must have annual license.
notes:
9:30 Beginner races for anyone new to the sport of Cyclocross with men’s and womens fields.  Opportunity to race a second race at 11:00am.

Second race entry is $20

Mountain Bike/hybrids legal as long as they do not have bar ends

Helmets requiired at all times.

Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as leaders.
directions: From either east or west, take Interstate 376 to Exit 77, Swissvale. Head south on S. Braddock Ave for 2.2 miles to Carrie Furnace Blvd.

title: West Chester Cross Classic #2
description:
lways better the second time around!  WCCX #2 is back again for 2017 and is the PACX CHAMPIONSHIP this year.  Being held at a brand new venue with course design once again by "angry" Bob.  Come on out and enjoy fall weather cross at it's best!

WCCX is consistently rated one of the top cross overall races in the PACX series.  This year the course will be completely new at a completely new venue...conveniently located near West Chester, PA. Don't miss an All NEW venue for 2017!  The Phelps School - 583 Sugartown Road, Malvern PA 19355
course: Classic cyclocross course with two sets of barriers and variable terrain mostly grass, with some pavement and gravel. The 1.8 mile closed course is great for spectators. Course will be flowing and challenging, making use of natural run-ups, off cambers sections, and lots of cornering. While the venue is new...the course is still designed by “angry” Bob Reuther, local cross legend and long time advocate of local cycling...so you know it will be AWESOME!
registration:
Pre-registration will be open on bikereg.com until November 17, 2017 11:00PM.

·         There is a $10 late fee for day-of registration.

·         Day of Registration and sign-in will be open at 8AM and will close 30 min prior to each race.

·         A USAC license is required to participate in this race, day-of and annual licenses will be available for purchase at registration.

·         Additional races - only $10!

·         Registration price includes $3 USAC insurance fee.
notes:
Call-up Protocol: 
·         Call-ups will only be awarded by promoter discretion. We will utilize current PACX series standings.
·         Staging will begin 10 minutes prior to each race

 Lapped Riders:

Lapped riders will finish on the same lap as the leaders. Riders in danger of being lapped must yield to oncoming racers and are not to interfere with their progress or trail behind them.

 Technical Pit:

A double sided pit will be marked and available approximately halfway through the course. If riders enter the pit, they must make some sort of exchange or mechanical adjustment.

Results:

Results will be posted at the registration area. Results will be made final 15 minutes after being posted. Podium, awards, and photos will occur roughly a half hour after each race.

Note:

·         The course will be open for inspection and warm-up at approximately 8:00am.

·         Every racer must have an approved helmet.

·         Mountain bikes will be allowed WITHOUT bar ends.

·         No aero bars. 

·         Check out our Website for updates and photos!

Disclaimer:

The Promoter reserves the right to combine categories, change times, etc.

Prizes*:

See Registration page.   Note that if field minimums of 20 for the Pro 1/2/3 and 15 for all other cash paying races aren't met, cash prizes will be cut by 50% or to 50% of total entry fees collected at race promoter discression.
directions: GPS Address:  The Phelps School - 583 Sugartown Road, Malvern PA 19355
